Method Detail

getRepositories

public String[] getRepositories(String server_url,
                                String username,
                                String password,
                                String read_write)
                         throws RemoteException
Return a list of all repositories that match the "read_write" criterion.

Parameters:
server_url - the URL of the meta-data server that will be queried (e.g. http://www.host.org:8080/sesame)
username - the username of the user to access the repository as used by the meta-data server (e.g. testuser)
password - the password of the user to access the repository as used by the meta-data server (e.g. opensesame
read_write - a string containing the optional characters "r" or "w" that indicate whether you want to see read-only repositories ("r") or read-write reposiory ("rw") for the indicated user. An empty string imposes no restriction.
Throws:
RemoteException

getRepositoriesLabel

public String[][] getRepositoriesLabel(String server_url,
                                       String username,
                                       String password,
                                       String read_write)
                                throws RemoteException
Return a list of all repositories that match the "read_write" criterion. This version returns: - and for Sesame repository - and for non Sesame repository

Parameters:
server_url - the URL of the meta-data server that will be queried (e.g. http://www.host.org:8080/sesame)
username - the username of the user to access the repository as used by the meta-data server (e.g. testuser)
password - the password of the user to access the repository as used by the meta-data server (e.g. opensesame
read_write - a string containing the optional characters "r" or "w" that indicate whether you want to see read-only repositories ("r") or read-write reposiory ("rw") for the indicated user. An empty string imposes no restriction.
Throws:
RemoteException

addRdf

public boolean addRdf(String server_url,
                      String repository,
                      String username,
                      String password,
                      String rdf_format,
                      String data_uri,
                      String data)
               throws RemoteException
Add a string of RDF data (that encodes a set of triples) into a repository.

Parameters:
server_url - the URL of the meta-data server that will be queried (e.g. http://www.host.org:8080/sesame)
repository - the name of the repository or model in the meta-data server (e.g. mem-rdfs-db)
username - the username of the user to access the repository as used by the meta-data server (e.g. testuser)
password - the password of the user to access the repository as used by the meta-data server (e.g. opensesame)
rdf_format - the encoding of the RDF (e.g. rdfxml, turtle, ntriples, etc.)
data_uri - the default URI for the RDF snippet (in the sense of the "base uri" used in Sesame, e.g. to name blank nodes. Use the name of an ontology or file to which the snippet belongs.)
data - the string of RDF data encoded in "rdf_format"
Returns:
true or false, indicating success of the operation
Throws:
RemoteException

addRdfWithContext

public boolean addRdfWithContext(String server_url,
                                 String repository,
                                 String username,
                                 String password,
                                 String rdf_format,
                                 String data_uri,
                                 String data,
                                 String context)
                          throws RemoteException
Add a string of RDF data (that encodes a set of triples) into a repository.

Parameters:
server_url - the URL of the meta-data server that will be queried (e.g. http://www.host.org:8080/sesame)
repository - the name of the repository or model in the meta-data server (e.g. mem-rdfs-db)
username - the username of the user to access the repository as used by the meta-data server (e.g. testuser)
password - the password of the user to access the repository as used by the meta-data server (e.g. opensesame)
rdf_format - the encoding of the RDF (e.g. rdfxml, turtle, ntriples, etc.)
data_uri - the default URI for the RDF snippet (in the sense of the "base uri" used in Sesame, e.g. to name blank nodes. Use the name of an ontology or file to which the snippet belongs.)
data - the string of RDF data encoded in "rdf_format"
context - the URI of an rdf:Bag that should "contain" a reified version of the triple after addition to the repository, using rdf:member (increases memory usage by a factor 6)
Returns:
true or false, indicating success of the operation
Throws:
RemoteException

addRdfStatement

public boolean addRdfStatement(String server_url,
                               String repository,
                               String username,
                               String password,
                               String subject,
                               String predicate,
                               String object)
                        throws RemoteException
Add an RDF triple into a repository.

Parameters:
subject - the URI of the subject of the triple (e.g. http://www.example.com/eg#aResource)
predicate - the URI of the predicate of the triple (e.g. http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#subClassOf)
object - either the URI of the object of the triple, or a literal value that can be typed using XML Schema, or can be assigned a language. (e.g. http://www.example.com/eg#aResource or Reticulation or "Reticulation"^^ or "Reticulation"@en. NB! that typing or assignment of a language requires you to (double)quote the string.)
Returns:
true or false, indicating success of the operation
Throws:
RemoteException

addRdfStatementWithContext

public boolean addRdfStatementWithContext(String server_url,
                                          String repository,
                                          String username,
                                          String password,
                                          String subject,
                                          String predicate,
                                          String object,
                                          String context)
                                   throws RemoteException
Add an RDF triple into a repository.

Parameters:
subject - the URI of the subject of the triple (e.g. http://www.example.com/eg#aResource)
predicate - the URI of the predicate of the triple (e.g. http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#subClassOf)
object - either the URI of the object of the triple, or a literal value that can be typed using XML Schema, or can be assigned a language. (e.g. http://www.example.com/eg#aResource or Reticulation or "Reticulation"^^ or "Reticulation"@en. NB! that typing or assignment of a language requires you to (double)quote the string.)
context - the URI of an rdf:Bag that should "contain" a reified version of the triple after addition to the repository, using rdf:member (increases memory usage by a factor 6)
Returns:
true or false, indicating success of the operation
Throws:
RemoteException

constructQuery

public String constructQuery(String server_url,
                             String repository,
                             String username,
                             String password,
                             String query_language,
                             String rdf_format,
                             String query)
                      throws RemoteException
Pose a "CONSTRUCT" query to the repository.

Parameters:
server_url - the URL of the meta-data server that will be queried (e.g. http://www.host.org:8080/sesame)
repository - the name of the repository or model in the meta-data server (e.g. mem-rdfs-db)
username - the username of the user to access the repository as used by the meta-data server (e.g. testuser)
password - the password of the user to access the repository as used by the meta-data server (e.g. opensesame)
query_language - the language in which the query is formulated (e.g. sparql, serql, etc.)
query - the query (e.g. construct {s} p {o} from {o} p {s})
rdf_format - the format of the resulting RDF that is returned
Returns:
a string containing an encoding of all constructed triples
Throws:
RemoteException

selectQuerySerialized

public String selectQuerySerialized(String server_url,
                                    String repository,
                                    String username,
                                    String password,
                                    String query_language,
                                    String select_output_format,
                                    String query)
                             throws RemoteException
Pose a "SELECT" query to the repository. (for HTML table output)

Parameters:
server_url - the URL of the meta-data server that will be queried (e.g. http://www.host.org:8080/sesame)
repository - the name of the repository or model in the meta-data server (e.g. mem-rdfs-db)
username - the username of the user to access the repository as used by the meta-data server (e.g. testuser)
password - the password of the user to access the repository as used by the meta-data server (e.g. opensesame)
query_language - the language in which the query is formulated (e.g. sparql, serql, etc.)
query - the query (e.g. select distint p from {s} p {o})
select_output_format - the format of the resulting table that contains the results (currently only "html_table" is supported. This operation is only meant for the presentation of the results to human viewers.)
Returns:
a string containing an encoding of all selected values
Throws:
RemoteException

selectQuery

public String[][] selectQuery(String server_url,
                              String repository,
                              String username,
                              String password,
                              String query_language,
                              String query)
                       throws RemoteException
Pose a "SELECT" query to the repository. (for use in a program)

Parameters:
server_url - the URL of the meta-data server that will be queried (e.g. http://www.host.org:8080/sesame)
repository - the name of the repository or model in the meta-data server (e.g. mem-rdfs-db)
username - the username of the user to access the repository as used by the meta-data server (e.g. testuser)
password - the password of the user to access the repository as used by the meta-data server (e.g. opensesame)
query_language - the language in which the query is formulated (e.g. serql, sparql, etc.)
query - the query (e.g. select distinct p from {s} p {o})
Returns:
an array of arrays containing the result table (e.g. "select s, o from {s} p {o}" could return [["http://www.example.com/eg#Doormat","Doormat"],["http://www.example.com/eg#Doorknob","Doorknob"], ...])
Throws:
RemoteException
